00022     #define OS_SCHEDULER_PRE_INTERRUPT_HOOK()

00031 struct os_process os_app = {
00032     .next = &os_app,
00033     .type = OS_PROCESS_TYPE_APPLICATION,
00034 #if CONFIG_OS_USE_PRIORITY == true
00035     .priority = OS_PRIORITY_1,
00036     .priority_counter = OS_PRIORITY_1,
00037 #endif
00038 };

00042 struct os_process *os_current_process = &os_app;

00050 #if CONFIG_OS_USE_PRIORITY == true
00051 struct os_process *os_scheduler(void)
00052 {
00053     do {
00054         // Get the next process
00055         os_current_process = os_current_process->next;
00056         // Check wether its priority counter is null
00057         if (!os_current_process->priority_counter) {
00058             os_current_process->priority_counter =
00059                     os_current_process->priority;
00060             OS_SCHEDULER_PRE_INTERRUPT_HOOK();
00061             return os_current_process;
00062         }
00063         // Decrease the priority counter
00064         os_current_process->priority_counter--;
00065     } while (true);
00066 }
00067 #else
00068 struct os_process *os_scheduler(void)
00069 {
00070     os_current_process = os_current_process->next;
00071     OS_SCHEDULER_PRE_INTERRUPT_HOOK();
00072     return os_current_process;
00073 }
00074 #endif
00075 
00076 struct os_process *os_get_current_process(void)
00077 {
00078     return os_current_process;
00079 }
00080 
00081 void __os_process_enable(struct os_process *proc)
00082 {
00083     struct os_process *last_proc = proc;
00084 
00085     // Look for the last process registered
00086     last_proc = os_current_process->next;
00087     while (last_proc->next != os_current_process->next) {
00088         last_proc = last_proc->next;
00089     }
00090     // Add the process to the chain list. Different behavior regarding the
00091     // application task because for the event handler uses this proc to run
00092 #if CONFIG_OS_USE_EVENTS == true
00093     // The application process is disabled in the event scheduler
00094     proc->next = last_proc->next;
00095 #else
00096     // If the application process is running, remove it from the active process
00097     // list
00098     if (os_process_is_application(last_proc)) {
00099         proc->next = proc;
00100     }
00101     else {
00102         proc->next = last_proc->next;
00103     }
00104 #endif
00105     last_proc->next = proc;
00106 }
00107 
00108 void os_process_enable(struct os_process *proc)
00109 {
00110     // The following code is critical
00111     os_enter_critical();
00112     // Make sure the task is not already enabled
00113     if (!os_process_is_enabled(proc)) {
00114         __os_process_enable(proc);
00115     }
00116     os_leave_critical();
00117 }
00118 
00119 bool os_process_is_enabled(struct os_process *proc)
00120 {
00121     // Starts from the "next" element.
00122     // There is maximum 1 element on the path before reaching the circular
00123     // chain buffer.
00124     struct os_process *last_proc = os_current_process->next;
00125     do {
00126         if (last_proc == proc) {
00127             return true;
00128         }
00129         last_proc = last_proc->next;
00130     } while (last_proc != os_current_process->next);
00131     return false;
00132 }
00133 
00134 void __os_process_disable(struct os_process *proc)
00135 {
00136     struct os_process *last_proc = proc;
00137 
00138     // Look for the last process
00139     while (last_proc->next != proc) {
00140         last_proc = last_proc->next;
00141     }
00142     // Remove the process from the chain list
00143     if (last_proc == proc) {
00144         // If this was the last process in the chain list, then remove
00145         // it and add the application process instead
00146         os_app.next = &os_app;
00147         proc->next = &os_app;
00148         os_app.type = OS_PROCESS_TYPE_APPLICATION;
00149     }
00150     else {
00151         last_proc->next = proc->next;
00152     }
00153 }
00154 
00155 void os_process_disable(struct os_process *proc)
00156 {
00157     // Unregister this process from the active process list
00158     os_enter_critical();
00159     // Make sure the process is enabled
00160     if (os_process_is_enabled(proc)) {
00161         __os_process_disable(proc);
00162     }
00163     os_switch_context(false);
00164     os_leave_critical();
00165 }
00166 
00167 void os_yield(void)
00168 {
00169     os_enter_critical();
00170     os_switch_context(false);
00171     os_leave_critical();
00172 }
